t: Prayer for Deliverance from Evil Men
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
Deliver*pn me, O Lord,*s from evil men; Preserve*ld me from violent men,
Who*ld plan evil things in their*i hearts; They*ld continually gather together for*i war.
They*ld sharpen their tongues like a serpent; The*ld poison of asps is*i under their lips. Selah*ipg
Keep*pn me, O Lord,*s from the hands of the wicked; Preserve*ld me from violent men, Who*ld have purposed to make my steps stumble.
The*ld proud have hidden a snare for me, and cords; They*ld have spread a net by the wayside; They*ld have set traps for me. Selah*ipg
I*pn said to the Lord:*s “You are*i my God; Hear*ld the voice of my supplications, O Lord.*s
O*ld God*s the Lord, the strength of my salvation, You*ld have covered my head in the day of battle.
Do*ld not grant, O Lord,*s the desires of the wicked; Do*ld not further his wicked*i scheme, Lest*ild they be exalted. Selah*ipg
“As*ipn for*i the head of those who surround me, Let*ld the evil of their lips cover them;
Let*ld burning coals fall upon them; Let*ld them be cast into the fire, Into*ld deep pits, that they rise not up again.
Let*ld not a slanderer be established in the earth; Let*ld evil hunt the violent man to overthrow him.”*i
I*ln know that the Lord*s will maintain The*ld cause of the afflicted, And*ild justice for the poor.
Surely*ld the righteous shall give thanks to Your name; The*ld upright shall dwell in Your presence.
